description: A statusChange trap signifies that the status of an object has changed. ::= { traps 1 }
DESCRIPTION The name of the host on which the event occurred.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD SMA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::statusChange SMA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::hostName s EXAMPLE SMA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::moduleName s EXAMPLE SMA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::statusOID o 1.3.6.1.4.1.8072.2.1.1 SMA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::statusOIDContext s EXAMPLE SMA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::status s EXAMPLE SMA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::description s EXAMPLE SMA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::dataValue s EXAMPLE SMA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::dataValueType i 0

description: The name of the host on which the event occurred.
variables.name: SMA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::hostName

description: The name of the module on which the event has occured.
variables.name: SMA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::moduleName

description: The identification of the object for which the status changed.
variables.name: SMA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::statusOID

description: The name of context incase the status OID is registered under a particular
context. If there is no special context, the value for this field will be null.
variables.name: SMA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::statusOIDContext

description: The current status of the object. One of OK, INFO, WARNING, ERROR.
variables.name: SMA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::status

description: The detailed description of the event.
variables.name: SMA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::description

description: The current value of the object, that generates the event.
variables.name: SMA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::dataValue

description: The data type of the value that is present in dataValue varbind
variables.name: SMA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::dataValueType
